BC they are Electric Diploe "Same magnitude cancel out"

Let's look the Electric dipole in this way. Consider the chemical compound H-Cl(Hydrochloride) ,There is a huge difference in their electronegativities. Due to the  high electronegativity of chlorine atom, pulls  the shared pair of electrons  towards itself. Thereby creating a charge separation. The shorter format of these explanation can be called an Electric dipole
if the charges are not moving toward eachother anymore, there is no net force between them.
@EdgeStormcrow  why aren't they moving towards each other?
Let's be honest .... How many of you feel sleepy during the course of this lecture ,😃😪😪😪😪

I don't have a precise definition for it.  The dipole moment is a measure of charge separation.  A neutral molecule or object that has a perfect even distribution of positive and negative charge has a dipole moment of zero.  A molecule that has charge separation, (one side positive and the other side negative) has a net dipole moment.  The greater the dipole, the greater the magnitude of charge separation also known as polarization.  Polar molecules like water tend to have a permanent dipole - the oxygen part of water has a partial negative charge and the hydrogen atoms bear a partial positive.  That's my way of describing dipole moments - a measure of charge separation / polarization.  I hope that helps :)  If not, that's all I got.
